event.name: NEXUS_PORTAL
event.text: The coordinates you found in Sylvan's secret room lead to a seemingly unremarkable stretch of space. You detect a couple anomalous signals but your preliminary scans can't lock onto anything.

choice.text: (Anomaly Detector) Your scanners are showing all kinds of strange results.

event.text: Your advanced scanners lock onto a strange anomaly some distance away. You track it down and soon find yourself in the atmosphere of a vast ocean planet facing a giant rift. For a few moments you can bring yourself to do nothing other than stare in awe until you snap back to reality and take notice of the even more unusual patterns of this particular rift. It's unusually stable, and if you didn't know better you'd almost say it's man-made...

choice.text: Guess there was no point to coming here.

event.text: As disappointing as it is, you can't discern any reason for having come here. Guess this was just a waste of time. Or maybe there was something more that you just couldn't find...

choice.text: We aren't leaving until we find out what this is.

event.text: It seems you're on your last legs. You won't survive much longer, but Sylvan stops firing for a moment and hails you. "I don't wisssh to kill you ssstranger. Leave, and we can forget about thissss..."

event.name: SURRENDERED_TO_SYLVAN
event.text: Sylvan powers down his weapons for good and takes one last look at you, guilt all over his face, and slips away into the distance.
"Ssstubborn to the end, ssstranger. I sssee how it isss..."

event.name: NEXUS_PORTAL_SURRENDER
event.text: It seems Sylvan is on the brink of destruction. You aren't sure if you really want to kill him.

event.name: SYLVAN_SURRENDERED
event.text: "It... it ssseemssss I have failed, ssstranger. I could not sssave you from yourssself. Oh well... I guessss you have earned what issss on the other end of that rift. But I hope you underssstand ssstranger that... well... you probably won't make it out the other ssside. There are rulesss, ssstranger. They won't like you breaking them." With that ominous note, Sylvan simply jumps away. You notice a lot of debris left from the fight and collect what you can.

event.name: SYLVAN_CREWKILL_NEXUSPORTAL
event.text: It seems as though this is the end of Sylvan, but suddenly a teleporter signal registers - you've been boarded, again? Sylvan reappears on your deck. "Sssstranger, it'ssss not sssso eassssy to get rid of me!"
As if that wasn't enough, even more Slugs beam aboard! Where are these guys coming from?

event.name: SYLVAN_DESTRUCTION_2_NEXUS
event.text: Though a strong layer of Slug sealant keeps the ship together as it begins to break, eventually it gives away under the stress and the ship explodes, scattering cargo containers across the system.
You scoop up the first cargo box, and empty out all of the scrap inside.
You open another cargo box, finding even more scrap.
You open another cargo box, finding a weapon and more supplies!
You open another cargo box, finding a drone among the supplies!
You open another cargo box, finding a ton of fuel and scrap inside.
You open another cargo box, finding a ton of missiles and scrap inside.
You open another cargo box, finding a ton of drone parts and scrap inside.
You open another cargo box, finding a brand new augment and some supplies inside!
You open another cargo box, finding even more supplies!
You open another cargo box, finding a ton of missiles!
You open another cargo box, finding a ton of drone parts!
You open another cargo box, finding even more scrap.
You open the final box and, to no surprise, you find even more scrap!

event.name: NEXUS_PORTAL_ENTER
event.text: There's only one choice left to be made here. This rift seems to be some kind of gateway, but do you really want to see what's on the other side?

As you begin to approach the rift, the space around you becomes progressively more warped, and soon not even your engines are able to control your ship as you're sucked at absurd speeds into the heart of the gateway...
It's a tough call, but your primary mission is too important to risk exploring ancient space anomalies.

event.name: SYLVAN_DESTRUCTION_NEXUS
event.text: Sylvan falls to his knees, bleeding profusely from a gash across his face. He manages to gasp out a few final words, "Ssstranger... I hope... thissss wasss worth it...", then falls over. Another Traveling Merchant is no more.

event.name: SYLVAN_NEXUS

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Yet another strange Sylvan awaits you here. They seem friendly enough and willing to trade.
"I ssssee you are in fact me, me. I'm afraid no dissscountsss though. There's an infinite me'sss and I can't go giving all of them free ssscrap!"
"Maybe a different time then, ssstranger! I'm certain thisss won't be the lassst we sssee each other, in thisss reality or another."

event.name: SYLVAN_TRADES_NEXUS
event.text: "Aaaaah. Ssstranger ssstranger, any ssself ressspecting Multiversssse traveler knowssss they need sssome gear if they're going to ssssurvive."

event.name: START_NEXUS
event.text: You pull yourself off the floor of your ship and glance out the window to try and place where you are in space and time. In the distance is another massive rift leading back to where you came from, slowly shrinking. This sudden disappearance should throw the Rebellion for quite a loop, but who knows if you'll make it out alive of whatever this is.

event.name: START_NEXUS_2
event.text: Once fully conscious you check the ship's vital systems but find everything has been shut down. A strangely colored Slug transport lingers nearby, and before you can react you hear a cough from behind you. You spin around to find a Slug dressed in an ironed suit and tie sitting at a makeshift folding table, holding a briefcase and a stack of papers. "Hello... ssstranger. Would you care to... have a ssseat?"

event.name: START_NEXUS_3
event.text:
You take a seat across from the Slug, who extends a tentacle towards you. "Greetingssss, Ssstranger. Under thessse circumssstances perhapssss it isss... irrelevant to make your acquaintance... but I like to be cordial. The name'ssss... G-Van. Unfortunately, thissss iss not jussst a ssssimple... meet and greet. I have sssome quessstionsss I would like to... asssk you."
The Slug flips through his papers, pulls out a pen, and looks back up at you. "Now then... who issss it that sssent you?"

choice.text: We were sent by no one.

event.text: "You expect me to... believe that? We have... placed consssiderable sssecurity measssuresss around thisss place, and I doubt sssomething like yourssself could have... made itsss way in alone. I would... appreciate more cooperation from you, ssstranger..."

event.name: START_NEXUS_4
event.text: "Did your Sylvan... put you up to thissss, ssstranger? Or did they attempt to... ssstop you? It isss very important we understand what... hands we left your reality in."
"Oh... I ssssee now. Ssso you really don't know... where you are. Oh... oh my. You poor creature... Well, I wissssh no cruelty upon you, ssstranger. Would you like an... explanation?"

G-Van shuffles his papers around and slips out a cartooney infographic, labeling various points on what is presumably the Multiverse. "Currently, sssstranger, you will find yourssself to be within what we call... the "Nexussss". Thisss isss the functional... center of the Multiversssse. Long ago, the Ssssylvansss of the Multiverssse disscovered thisss place thanksss to the help of our... leader, Ssssylvan Prime. At firssst we essstablished merely a... trade alliance, but sssoon when we realized the threatssss held within the Multiverssse it became clear it would be our... resssponssibility to protect it as well."
"To protect the Multiverssse from sssaid threatsss, we founded the C.E.L. - That isss... the Continuity Enforcement League. Unfortunately for you, sssstranger, part of the C.E.L.'sss sssacred... creed issss that we cannot allow anyone elssse to enter or leave the Nexussss... Which meansss, unfortunately, my only option now isss to... eliminate you."

event.name: START_NEXUS_5
event.text: "I'm afraid I... am not authorized to accept any pleasss for mercy from you. Pleassse, ssstranger, do not make this any... harder for me than it already issss." You rush to your battle stations but find your systems are still limited. Like this you'll hardly stand much of a chance!

Irwin seems dumbfounded for a moment, dropping his blunderbuss and stretching his eyestalks with his tentacles. "Oh my god. Holy ssshit. Holy actual ssshit. I WASSSS RIGHT! I WASSS RIGHT THISSS ENTIRE TIME! THEY CALLED ME A LUNATIC, ABSSSOLUTELY OUT OF MY MIND! And yet here we are! Even more, it'sss YOU! SSSYLVAN! You ssslimy traitorous asssshole. I ssshould have killed you the minute I met you. But oh... oh I'm gonna make you pay. I'm gonna make all of you god damn freaksss pay for taking EVERYTHING from me! YOU WILL RUE THE DAY YOU MESSSSED WITH IRWIN!"
G-Van seems utterly confused at this outburst. "Uh... I'm afraid I don't know who you... are...?" Irwin nods. "Oh, but you will. You will know exactly who I am after thissss." Irwin picks up his blunderbuss and brandishes it, ready to use it to obliterate any Sylvan in his path. With no other options left, you get ready to fight. Unfortunately, your systems are still offline, and you aren't sure how much of a chance you'll stand despite your crew's... "enthusiasm".

"Very well then. I ssshall get right to busssinesss then. By dictate of our divine leader, Ssssylvan Prime, the mossst sssacred rule of our creed isss that no one besssidesss ourssselvesss may ever enter or leave thisss place. Thusss... I'm afraid I will now have to... eliminate you."

choice.text: We were led to this place by a weird Auto-ship.

event.text: G-Van looks up at you, mildly confused. "A... what? I do not... underssstand what you mean. Like... a probe? Or... oh, nevermind. The Multiverssse isss... infinite, there could be ssso many... explanationsss anywayssss."

choice.text: Thest told us how to get here.

event.text: G-Van frowns. "Unfortunate... I did not think the Zoltan would... betray usss. I do not... wisssh to sssee harm come to any of them, but I cannot let thisss go... unreported either. choice.text: This Gnome really wanted us to come here.

event.text: "The... the what? Ssstranger, what the hell have you done? You have brought that... thing here! If thissss isss what I believe it to be, thisss isss an... immediate containment crisssisss."

event.name: NEXUS_ENTER_GLITCH_CONTINUE
event.text: To your surprise, your systems suddenly return back to normal! You aren't sure what caused it, but you don't have time to worry about it. It seems G-Van is confused by it as well, but now that you're a more considerable threat, it looks like he's going to have to step up his game!

event.name: GUARD_NEXUS_AI
event.text: It seems killing G-Van and his crew wasn't enough - the ship has some kind of secondary AI mode and is still in the fight!

event.name: GUARD_NEXUS_DEFEAT
event.text: G-Van has been defeated. While his reluctance to fight you might have given an out to spare him, you make your decision resolute. With nothing else stopping your way deeper into the Nexus, you scrap his ship and prepare yourself mentally for whatever comes next.

event.name: NEXUS_GUARD_SURRENDER
event.text: G-Van's ship isn't holding up well. You notice his resolve in fighting you has dropped considerably, and if you wished you could likely spare him.

"Ssso... here I am then, ssstranger. At the... mercy of an interloper I wassss sssupposssed to kill. Why... ssspare me? Do you have any idea the thingsss I've done, ssstranger? The thingsss we've done? If you don't now... then you will. You'll wisssh you never... met a Sssylvan. Ssso... if you want my advice, ssstranger. Run for the exit. Don't ssscrew with Prime. Maybe... maybe he'll cut you a... deal, ssstranger."

choice.text: We've handled worse. Whatever Prime throws at us, we can take.

event.text:
G-Van shakes his head, moaning as he rests his eyestalks on his tentacles. "No, ssstranger, you don't ssstand a chance againssst Prime. Do you realize... what it isss you're ssssaying? A lowly mortal... Renegade, againssst the one who rulesss of all Existence? Don't be a... fool, ssstranger. If Prime could be toppled, then we would have... done sssso already."
G-Van coughs, spewing up some blood. "Though... there issss one... explanation as to why you are here which... I hessitate to accept. If She hasss decided to... finally turn the tablesss, well... that changesss everything."
"You will ssssee... sssoon enough. If I am correct, at leassst... Leave me here... I mussst face my fate alone."

choice.text: You can face your fate after you help us.

event.text: G-Van attempts to protest, but you dock with his ship and drag him aboard. Too weak to fight against you, he finally gives in and cooperates. "Fine... if I am to die to... Prime either way, then I will not die a... coward..."
G-Van ship, left a wreck, will presumably be recovered by his accomplices eventually. What his fate will be at the hands of Prime is uncertain, but you have other things to worry about first.

event.text: Having been directed here as the supposed location of Sylvan Prime, you find yourself face to face with nothing but the starry abyss. It dawns upon you that, should you choose this moment to leave, there's likely no turning back. If you want to explore the Nexus further, here's your chance.

choice.text: You feel as though you should keep exploring.

event.name: TEST_FIGHT_PRIME
event.text: Fight.

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_MEET
event.text: Suddenly, behind you appears a massive cruiser vessel, bigger and perhaps better armed than any ship you've ever seen before. A large compartment opens to reveal a docking port, and it seems obvious you should dock. That is, unless you'd like to be annihilated on the spot for refusing this hospitality.

As you exit your ship, you find yourself in a brightly lit lobby full of glistening marble fountains and gigantic statues. Three armored Slugs approach and bow to you. "Greetingssss, ssstranger. Hisss royal divinity, Sssir Sssylvan Hektar Prime, has requesssted you attend hisss council immediately. While we are certain you will comply, it is my advice that you do not face the impending vaporization of attempting to flee."

choice.text: Go with them to see Prime.

event.text:
The Slugs march you into an even larger and grander room, with ceilings so high you're certain they defy the possible limits of the ship's size. An angelic choir fills the room as a compartment opens above you, and from the blinding white space above two rings descend in your direction. You watch in awe as a Slug is revealed between them, arms outstretched, a majestic light cast upon him. Still hovering above you, he claps, and the guards leave the room.
"And ssso we meet at lassst, ssstranger. My congratulationsss, on sssurviving until now. I think your effortsss mossst certainly dessserve to be repaid. Would you like some tea?" Without even waiting for a response, a white triangular drone enters the room ferrying small cups already full. Prime doesn't take one himself, instead finally descending all the way to the ground. "I do hope my accomplicesss have been treating you well - and that you've been treating them well in return." Prime turns away from you and floats towards a window facing out into the abyss.
"Do you sssee thissss, ssstranger? The vasssstnesss of the abyssss? We're at the very center of the Multiverssse right now. The center of Everything. The center of Anything. Had you asssked me, oh so many yearsss ago, if I would ever sssit here, god amongssst all othersss, well... I think it'sss pointlesss to ssssay I wouldn't have believed it. Ssso tell me, ssstranger. What do you think of it all? If you've done your homework, by now sssurely you've gathered what it isss we do here. I already underssstand that I have been betrayed by multiple cooperatives of mine. But what do YOU think?"

choice.text: You're despicable, controlling the entire Multiverse like this.

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_EXPLAIN
event.text:
"And ssso another one sssimply failsss to underssstand... failsss to underssstand the fundamental truth. Ssstranger, do you not sssee? I am not the firssst to fill thisss role. And I will not be the lassst, I am certain. For eons, sssince perhapsss the beginning of time, there have been a multitude of empiresss that have ruled the Nexusss. The desssecrated wasssstesss of whatever they once were, burdened by the cruel handsss of time, provide the lassst memoriesss of forgotten puppetmasssterss."
"The Multiversssse issss infinite, ssstranger. And infinite isss a very unssstable thing. The Multiverssse cannot sssussstain itssself without the hands of ssssomeone willing to carry the burden of maintaining it. It isss a thanklesss job. It is a grueling, horrible job. If only you knew, ssstranger, how much I wisssh I could go back to the old daysss when I wasss jussst a merchant. When I didn't have to play god for the sake of the life of every sssentient being in all of exissstence. But I can't go back. I don't asssk for your acceptance, nor your pity. I only asssk you underssstand that what I mussst do issss simply what I mussst do. For better, or for worssse. It is the only choice in thisss matter."

Quarantinesss might condemn many to die, but they prevent the inevitable sssspread of disssasssterss that would kill many more. It isss the choice between two evilsss, but it isss my unfortunate job to make the call to sssacrifice a comparative few to sssave the infinite many."

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_QUESTIONS
event.text: "Well, maybe there wasss a choice once, ssstranger. But thossse daysss are long gone now. But, enough of thissss. We have busssinesss to attend to, but I'm afraid I have been a mosssst terrible hossst. I can only imagine you are overwhelmed with information, but I will grant you one final chance to underssstand. To underssstand anything. It won't matter sssoon, anywaysss."

choice.text: (Obyn) "Where is your Obyn? Obyn Prime, I assume."

event.text: Prime pauses, taken off-guard. "Well... uhm... Hello, Obyn. It hasss been... it hassss been ssso long sssince I have seen my Obyn. That sssoundsss rather posssesssive, don't you think? MY Obyn. But... well... he isss no longer with me. And - do not asssume the worssst. I would never hurt him. We sssimply had a... disssagreement. One which I could never quite patch, and ssso we went our sssseparate waysss. I would prefer not to dissscusss it further."

choice.text: (Billy) "WHAT IN THE GOD DAMN ISSSS HAPPENING?!"

event.text:
"Oh, Billy... my brother, it hasss been ssso long sssince I have ssseen a verssssion of you." Billy seems to be on the verge of a panic attack. "YOU ARE NOT MY BROTHER! MY BROTHER DOESSSSN'T WEAR A TOGA, AND FLY AROUND IN SSSSOME SSSSPINNY RINGSSS! HOW DARE YOU CLAIM TO BE MY BROTHER, TO SSSSPIT ON HISSS NAME, TO... to... to..."
Prime seems genuinely upset. "Billy, I am not your brother. I am a verssssion of your brother, yessss. But I am not the versssion you know, nor do I claim to be. We lived different livessss in completely different ssstretchessss of ssspace and time. I know thisss mussst be bizarre, and painful, and truly incomprehenssssible. But that isss what the Multiverssse isss. It issss infinite, and in infinity anything can happen. Try not to think too hard about it, okay? I don't think it'll matter for much longer anywayssss..."

Anurak scoffs. "Silly me, I thought your non-interference came from a place of idealistic peaceful understanding! Look at you sitting in that preposterous throne room, with your lavish self-exaltation! Oh, you'll preach detachment, but sample all the luxuries the multiverse has to offer won't you!?"
"Anurak, pleasssse. Calm down- " Prime tries to continue but Anurak cuts him off. "Do you even remember that time on Argolida III - we were on the run, you recall - when we were out of supplies and I had to pull together some soup with the local cacti? Yes, we ended up drunk and confused and it tasted awful, but we were alive! We were surviving! Could you even conceive of doing that anymore?"
Sylvan Prime tries to interject again. "Lissssten, my Anurak-" Anurak cuts him off again. "Or do you remember that time when we were completely surrounded and you bargained your way out by turning the mercenaries - What were their names again? Harbo.... no, was it Derrinth? Yes, I think Derrinth was one of them. You turned Derrinth and what's-her-face against their employers by giving him your prized armchair and I think you gave that lady your drive core? You remember Derrinth, right? Died next year from a potassium overdose. Weird guy. The lady though, I don't think she even told us her name, she betrayed us like 3 days later anyway. That's the cost of dealing with people who would turn against their employers so easily, I guess. I wonder what happened to her."

Sylvan Prime tries to get another word in edgewise. "ANURAK! I'm not your Ssss-" Again, though, Anurak cuts him off. "Don't you remember sitting around a campfire just outside the Monastery, huddled up next to Obyn? We made such good soup that day. We used to grow the finest ingredients just outside. Your favorite, you used to call them 'smeepberries'. Never told me why. My memory isn't always the best but I remember it clear as day - you would go 'Why don't you add ssssome more sssssmeepberriessss'. Always made Obyn laugh - some inside joke you never let me in on, I guess. Well, maybe there wasn't any more to it than that. You were a funny guy back then. Now look at you! Acting like you did on that day when you tried to retrofit that classic Burst Cannon mark-"

"ENOUGH! If you won't lissssten, then there issss no compromisssse to be had!"
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, you shut your eyes and pray for help to come. But help isn't coming. You're all on your own for this fight.

"ENOUGH! If you won't lissssten, then there issss no compromisssse to be had!"
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, a salvo of lasers erupts from behind you, pattering against his shield! A familiar ship jumps in... it's Sylvan - YOUR Sylvan! "Ssstranger, the cavalry hasss arrived!" There's no more time for words to be exchanged, you have to fight! You aren't sure how effective Sylvan will be, but if you can combine your firepower and his, you might just stand a chance!

event.text: "Ssstranger, you do realize what we are dealing with here, yesss? I have an endlesss number of realitiesss to watch over, countlessss numbersss of reality destroying cataclysssmss to watch over. Thissss isss why we've sworn to an oath of neutrality, in all waysss we can try to enforce it. We Ssssylvansss could change the courssse of hissstory in every reality for the better... but we could alsssso change it for the worssse. Thisss iss the only way to make sssure we don't become the thingssss we work so hard to prevent. Thissss Multiverssse needsss Order, not Chaos. We have no time to handle futile warsss in every reality, no matter how bad they have become. Ssso long asss they do not threaten reality, then it issss not our place to intervene."

choice.text: Can you help this can of beans?

event.text: "I uh... what? Sssylvrick, isss that you?" The can of beans grunts in acknowledgement. "Yesss, jussst get me out of here already." Prime sighs. "God damn it, you promisssed to ssstop it with thessse absssurd... oh whatever. It doesssn't matter right now."

"Oh... ssso... I guesss we're done here then. I wisssh we had taken longer, but I sssuppossse we cannot ssstall any longer, ssstranger. I'm sssure you've prepared yourssself for what happensss next, but I want to try and make an offer. I know it may sssseem feeble, but if you want to ssskip the bloodsshed, perhapsss there'sss a sssolution yet. All I care about isss preventing you from leaking the exissstence of thisss place. While I cannot entrussst you to keep the sssecret on your own, perhapsss... we could sssimply erassse your memoriesss. You wouldn't die, just ssssimply forget everything. I know it ssssoundsss unnegotiable, but consssider the alternative. I don't want to kill you if I don't have to, and sssurely you don't wisssh to die, sssstranger.

choice.text: The only way out of this is for us to fight.

event.text:
"Asss I unfortunately sssussspected. Well, alright. I'm sssorry it hasss to be thisss way ssstranger. Goodbye."
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, you shut your eyes and pray for help to come. But help isn't coming. You're all on your own for this fight.

choice.text: The only way out of this is for us to fight.

event.text:
"Asss I unfortunately sssussspected. Well, alright. I'm sssorry it hasss to be thisss way ssstranger. Goodbye."
However, as Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, a salvo of lasers erupts from behind you, pattering against his shield! A familiar ship jumps in... it's Sylvan - YOUR Sylvan! "Ssstranger, the cavalry hasss arrived!" There's no more time for words to be exchanged, you have to fight! You aren't sure how effective Sylvan will be, but if you can combine your firepower and his, you might just stand a chance!
[To order Sylvan to unleash a salvo, use the new button located under the "Toggle Equipment" one.]

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_SURRENDER_REAL
event.text: Prime's ship has been crippled, and it seems he's losing his resolve to keep fighting you. "Ssstranger... you ssseem to have won. Heh... and I wasss ssso sssure I wasss going to have to kill you. Oh, the irony." Prime's rings collapse, and he falls to the ground, coughing up some green blood. "Well, the match issss... yoursss... do what you will."

You say nothing, instead reaching out your hand to Prime. Baffled by the gesture, he takes your hand and you help pull him off the floor. "Ssstranger... why would you ssspare me? After everything I've done to you? Have I not become a monssster? A loathsssome thing? How can there be mercy for me?"

choice.text: You did what you thought was right. This never had to end in bloodshed.

event.name: PRIME_SPARE
event.text:
"Well... I am forever grateful to you, ssstranger... I do not know if the C.E.L. can hold together after thisss, but I ssssuppossse we will have to sssee what happensss now... But it would be aimlesss now to ssstop you - ass if I even could... Well, you have earned your freedom. I only asssk of you ssstranger that, ssshould you reveal thisss sssecret, you really consssider the implicationsss."
Prime bows. "Farewell, ssstranger. No offenssse, but I hope we never meet again."

event.name: SHES_MAD
event.text:
Suddenly, you feel a foreboding presence as the space around you turns black. Prime looks on in horror as a formless and unimaginable terror envelopes everything in sight.
"I can't believe you'd do this, Renegade! I thought we were working together, but here you are! So, I didn't trick you, huh? Ohhh well. I was hoping even if you didn't fall for it, you'd at least see the reason in helping me." / :(
Prime looks to you with fear having consumed his face. "Ssstranger... did you make a deal with Her? Do you - do you even realize what ssshe isss? What ssshe wantsss? What ssshe'sss capable of if given power?"
"Prime, don't scare the Renegade! There's no reason to be vague. The Nexus IS my realm. Sure, I wasn't born here, but it is my rightful place to rule it, as the Supreme Eldritch Goddess of True Chaos. The Multiverse is so boring on its own. Here's all the tools you could ever want to spice things up, and instead you want to be boring and keep things the way they are! And you can't even manage that! You're a hypocrite, a coward, and worst of all, you're too weak to stop me. Because you know if you kill me, you'll lose all your power. You'll just be another worthless mortal, a squishy little Slug. And so you kept me around, and allowed all of this to happen! Hahe!" / :)

Several large tentacles spring out from the all consuming blackness around you, wrapping themselves around your ship.
"I really can't believe you betrayed me, Renegade! We could have had something. You could have worked with me, in a new glorious empire! But alas, while I may not be able to kill Prime, I can kill YOU!" / :)

choice.text: I've met many monsters on my travels. You're not like any of them.

event.text: You dock once again with Prime's ship and hunt the Slug down through the giant, extravagant hallways. When you find him, he reaches out his tentacle to shake your hand, but you instead draw your blaster and shoot him. While only artificially wounded for now, he still flies backwards. You reach over him and grab the rings, pulling them away from him. "Ssstranger... what are you doing? To kill me, I can underssstand... but do you even realize what thosssse ringsss are for? You mussst be careful with them!"

choice.text: Ignore his warning and proceed with the plan.

event.name: SHE_WINS
event.text:
As soon as you deactivate the rings, a foreboding blackness consumes the space around you.
"Wow, you actually did it! Good job Renegade, I knew you were just the right person to call for this. Hahe! Oh Prime, did you really think you could just keep me locked away forever? You gambled with eternity, and eternity won! It always wins. And eternity is on my side." / :)
You feel yourself pulled from your feet and are dragged back to your ship by an invisible force, while from the darkness spring several large, black tentacles that wrap themselves around Prime's ship. They squeeze the metal and twist the ship into a contorted wreck, until finally tearing it asunder. Prime gets no more final words - his time is up.

choice.text: There is no going back now, Renegade :)

event.name: SHE_IS_DEFEATED
event.text: As your hull is reduced to critical levels, you notice Prime himself has dismounted from his rings, and is now holding them above his head. "You're right, it wasss my missstake to keep you around. Good thing I didn't make the missstake of making it permanent." Prime brings down the rings hard against the floor, smashing them into pieces.

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_SURRENDER_GNOME
event.text:
Prime's ship has been crippled, and it seems he's losing his resolve to keep fighting you. "Ssstranger... you ssseem to have won. Heh... and I wasss ssso sssure I wasss going to have to kill you. Oh, the irony." Prime's rings collapse, and he falls to the ground, coughing up some green blood. "Well, the match issss..." Prime doesn't get to finish his sentence when a sudden "HAHE!" startles both of you.
The gnome appears behind Prime and begins to spin in the air, eventually shattering apart as a spread of black tentacles erupt from its porcelain skin. They wrap themselves around Prime and lift him into the air, beginning to pull the once great Slug to gruesome pieces. His screams turn to silence as the only thing left are his rings, which the tentacles wrap around and pull apart, shattering them.

The gnome vanishes from your ship, and with it the nightmarish effects on your mind seem to cease immediately. Unfortunately, you can't really focus on that right now with the eldritch being of pure evil you just unleashed.

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_SURRENDER_GNOME_2
event.text:
"Renegade, didn't you see this coming? Hahe! As I told you, when Prime defeated me, my power was divided into three parts which were scattered across the Multiverse. The third part, which was meant to be hidden away, was recovered by my marvelous little henchman and kept for just the right moment! Oh we've had so much fun trying to guide you silly little Renegades through this maze of secrets to get you here. It was only a matter of time of course until one of you brought the effigy here, and I'm very patient. We're on the dawn of a new era! Well, a return to a better era at least. Thank you for freeing me, Renegade! Unfortunately, I can't stick around for long. I have some other business I need to take care of, but I'll be back soon to... handle this place. Hahe! Bye-bye!" / :)
Your vision begins to go black as the entirety of space around you seems to shake. You feel like you're going mad, as what feels like an eternity of destruction fills your mind.

event.name: NEXUS_HER_HELP_BAD
event.text: When the maddening red has subsided, you awake on your ship and find yourself all alone save for Prime's now empty ship. Thanks to your rampage through the Nexus, the C.E.L. is too weak now to fight Her. With no one left capable of defeating her, your only choice is to wait for the inevitable.

event.name: NEXUS_HER_HELP_SYLVAN
event.text: When the maddening red has subsided, you awake to find your Sylvan standing over you. "Ssstranger, what happened? Are you alright?" Behind him are several others, all other C.E.L. members and other assorted Sylvans and Obyns.

There's a murmur in the crowd and a lot of panicked shouts. "Ssstranger, you can't be ssseriousss? You mean... Prime isss dead?" You nod. "Well... then there'sss only one hope for usss now. Chancesss are She returned to her home clussster to recruit the remainsss of her Eldritch family. It'sss extremely dangerousss, but we have no choice. We mussst follow Her. We'll give you all the fire sssupport we can provide. I don't know if it'll be enough, but we have to try. Jussst let usss know when you're ready."

event.name: NEXUS_ENDING_GOOD_SAVE
event.text:
You blink your eyes, and pull yourself off the floor of your ship. The nightmarish darkness has vanished, replaced instead by the charred and broken remains of Prime's ship, as well as a fleet of the other Sylvans surveying the damage. You still detect faint life signatures from on board Prime's ship, and receive a hail.
"Ssstranger, I have... done all that I can do. I do not... know if thisss will keep Her at bay forever, but now you are sssafe. Without her power, my life will sssoon fade... But the Nexusss ssstill sstandsss strong, and the C.E.L. withholdsss. There isss no need for me any longer... Asss ssuch, for what little it meansss... I hereby abdicate my rule." Prime coughs and collapses. "Goodbye, ssstranger..."

event.name: NEXUS_ENDING_BAD_SAVE
event.text:
You blink your eyes, and pull yourself off the floor of your ship. The nightmarish darkness has consumed Prime's ship and everything else. The shifting of a million all-seeing eyes stare down upon you, deciding your fate.
"Thank you dearest, for all your work in freeing me. Prime, the C.E.L... why, it's all in the past now. Forever more there will only be Me. Me, my family... but I'm afraid... not you. It's nothing personal, of course! You did me such a great service here today. It's just that... well, you're quite weak. Sure, you took out Prime, but it took quite a lot of prodding from me. And all those Sylvans you chose to spare? It put you in a deficit. You could have slaughtered your way right until the end, knowing what they were capable of and what they would do to you if they had the chance, but you just didn't. Your choice, but choices have consequences. But just for you friend, I'll make you a special deal. I'll destroy your cluster first, rather than torturing its inhabitants for centuries. Hahe!" / :)

You made quick work of all those Sylvans, the pests. You've done my work so well, so faithfully, and I hardly even had to ask you to! Every good empress needs Her executioner, and I think you will fit perfectly. All will know our wrath, Renegade." / :)

event.name: HER

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Find Me Find Me Find Me Find Me Find Me Find Me.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Lured in by the strange beacon marker, you don't immediately notice anything out of the ordinary. That said, being near the beacon gives you a sense of dread, like you're being watched from all angles.

"Finally, you've made it! Hahe! I've been waiting an awful long time for you to arrive, but finally I can introduce myself! Hello! I am Her. I hope you're doing well so far. I know this is probably pretty scary, being so far away from your reality." / :)
"Weren't you listening? I'm Her! I'm Sylvan Prime's... tool. His key to power, so to speak. Perhaps I should explain? Shouldn't take too long, I think!" / :)

Suddenly, all around you the space turns black as the distant twinkling stars are extinguished from view.
"Oh, where to even begin? Well, let us start from the beginning perhaps. You see, I am as you can likely tell, not a Sylvan. I come from another cluster entirely, one with very different properties from your own. The Multiverse is much, much bigger than you probably realize. This is why we invented the term 'cluster'. Clusters are nothing but an arbitrary classification, a way to organize realities that are barely distinguishable from each other." / :)
"But maybe you're wondering why this is all the way it is. Who are WE, exactly? Well, it's simple. Simple enough... One day, Prime and the other Sylvans took control of the Nexus through devious means. At first just a trade alliance, eventually they came to realize just how truly infinite and terrifying the Multiverse truly is. A mysterious entity invaded Prime's home cluster, and nearly triggered an event we refer to as R-Day. And so, the C.E.L. was born. To handle threats like that! It's a noble deed, but the agency is ran by a very unstable tyrant." / :O

choice.text: But what role do we play in this?

event.text:
"Oh, of course! Hahe! My bad. It's just... well it's not my favorite story to tell. You see, Prime is not the first to rule the Nexus. Long ago, this was my home. I am a very ancient being, something which long outdates the time in which your cluster achieved Multiverse travel. Against my better judgement, I let Prime enter the Nexus because he claimed to be an ambassador of a group of survivors closely linked to me - but instead, Prime merely tricked me." / :(
"When Prime had seized control over the Multiverse itself, I was enslaved to him. He divided my power among two containers, leaving only a third for me to control. The primary division of my power was placed in secret exile, but the second largest division is imbued in the special rings which Prime has that orbit him. Through this, he has not only become immune to my power - but the power of every agent within the C.E.L. as well. Now, he runs the show with no one who can stop him, and anyone who might is simply kept away. But now, things have changed. Prime did a good job convincing his agents this was all for the greater good once, and I don't even disbelieve he fell for his own lie... but no mortal can play god this long without inevitably falling victim to their own failings." / :\
"R-Day is not the only protocol the C.E.L. has. There are numerous catastrophic events in which the C.E.L. keeps a special eye out for. Among them is P-Day, perhaps the most... sensitive to Prime. One day, the enforcer named G-Van discovered a disturbing occurance in Cluster 363, which suggested that it had already befallen P-Day. A husk of what it once was, Prime took pity on the survivors once he realized the reality was so similar to his own. He offered a deal, and allowed a trio to scout out a new home for the refugees. However, when the P-Day event almost spread to an adjacent cluster, Prime panicked and pulled the plug. He condemned them all to die, and stranded the scouts in a foreign land with no help nor home. Fortunately, I was able to reach out to them, though it wasn't easy. But I can only help them so much, and there are many more who suffer under the iron fist of Prime. But... you can help!" / :(

"Yes! While I'm not able to defeat Prime, I've spent great amounts of effort to lead you here. If you can weaken Prime enough that he can't keep fighting, you can disable the rings and free me, allowing us to overthrow Prime! Only then can the Multiverse return to order. So, what do you say, Renegade? Are you in?" / :)

"Excellent! Hahe! When you reach Prime, it's inevitable you'll have to fight him to leave. Once you've weakened him to the point he can fight no more, move in and disable his rings. Only then will we be able to remove him from power. We're all counting on you, Renegade!" / :)

"Really? Well, that's quite unfortunate. You must understand there isn't much of a choice here! When you reach Prime, the only way you'll be able to leave is through fighting him. It's inevitable, but if you escape without killing him, he will hunt you down to the end of time to make sure his secret is never revealed. If you don't understand this now, then well... you will eventually. You can always change your mind later, and I hope you will!" / :(

"That's okay, it's a hard decision to make right now. But you must understand there isn't much of a choice here! When you reach Prime, the only way you'll be able to leave is through fighting him. It's inevitable, but if you escape without killing him, he will hunt you down to the end of time to make sure his secret is never revealed. Once he's weakened, you can disable his rings and free me, and only then can we remove him from power and you'll be safe. We're all counting on you, Renegade!" / :)

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_FIRST
event.text: As the Renegade approached the beacon, they stopped to wonder why the perspective of the event writing had changed. How strange, the Renegade thought. Just moments ago, the events had been written in the second person. And what was it with all of the meta crap? Events referencing themselves? How absurd! And absurd it was.

"What is going on?" The Renegade exclaimed out loud, almost driven to madness by the absurdity of what they were experiencing. But, little did they know, the answer was quite simple. Before them was an omnipotent entity known the Narrator, or as some might call them, Narrator Sylvan. The Narrator, of course, had no physical presence besides his ship, but he was never quite as excited as he was now to finally meet the Renegade "face" to face.

Why yes, yes I am! Oh so many stories we've told together! How much fun we've had! And look at you now, all grown up and in the big scary Nexus. Bet you didn't expect this twist, huh? Why, I've been narrating things for an awful long time now. I make mistakes, of course. Lot's of tpyos, and all that. But oh golly if it wasn't worth it just for this moment! Prime says it's to keep track of the movement of potential threats and anomalies, but I just do it for the love of the craft!

choice.text: If you're the narrator, can you give us something?

event.text: Oh I'm afraid not Renegade, I just tell the story. If you're looking for something to alter the fabric of reality, well, you'll have to look elsewhere. But- while you're here... I was thinking. We've known each other for so long but I don't know much about you, Renegade! So why don't we introduce ourselves at last. Here's a question I've always wondered; what are your preferred pronouns?

You can't be serious?! Renegade, I'm the Narrator! If I'm not arround, then who's going to tell your story? How will anything get done? Think about it! Attacking me is madness! Oh, but the Renegade was dead set on it. That bloodthirsty murderer wouldn't be satisfied until they had killed anything and everything that moved. What a shame it was, this beautiful moment ruined like it always had to be.

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_NAME
event.text: Oh this is just delightful, absolutely wonderful! But oh, oh, why stop there? We can do even better than that, Renegade! What's your name? I haven't quite figured out text fields yet, but we can go letter by letter!

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_WARNING
event.text: Stranger, what are you doing? If you kill me, the game will end!

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_END
event.text: Okay, okay, this is going to take too long. We can stop there. But oh, Renegade, this has been just splendid! Oh I feel terrible I didn't prepare a gift for you. I tell you what. Come visit me again, and I'll have something just wonderful prepared, alright? Goodbye, Renegade! I hope to see you again in the future.

With the strange meeting over, the Renegade prepared to move on. He waved a tearful goodbye to Narrator Sylvan, choked up with sadness he had to part ways, and only hoping they would meet again some day.

With the strange meeting over, the Renegade prepared to move on. She waved a tearful goodbye to Narrator Sylvan, choked up with sadness she had to part ways, and only hoping they would meet again some day.

Weirdo?! WEIRDO?! Why would you do this, Renegade? After everything we've been through? All the wonderful stories we've told? You've betrayed me like this, after I had promised you a gift? I am heartbroken! Positively shaken! I can't believe you would do this...

event.text: A bizarrely shaped blob of color moves towards you. It takes a few moments to recognize it as something at least vaguely similar to Sylvan. The ship hails you, and what seems to be a crudely drawn Slug with a smiley face begins to spin around in 2 dimensional space. "M A DYLAN! HELOO!!"
"YY!! I LIK U! U HAVE PASS TEST!"

When the day of judgement arrives, and the archangels of the highest heavens descend upon this accursed land to reap the souls of all those unworthy, your sins will be forgiven. You will be spared. I shall send this feeble mortal presence of mine alongside you as a token of light through the grim darkness ahead."

"N!! N!!!! You RUD. Umph!" The bizarre vessel suddenly turns hostile!

event.name: DYLAN_DEFEAT
event.text: "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!! AAAA!! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!" The Slug begins to spin with greater fervor, until it eventually explodes into a shower of hot chocolate.

event.name: NEXUS_LOSERS
event.text: A nearby station is broadcasting a looping message advertising some kind of convention. "Come one, come all, any Ssssylvanssss not currently employed by the C.E.L. are welcome to participate in the weekly S.I.L.V.A.N. meeting! Sssylvansss of particularly ssspecial abilitiesss extra welcome!!!"

Before you're allowed to dock, you're hailed by yet another Sylvan. "Welcome, ssstranger. Before you can enter, we'd like to verify - you are a Ssssylvan, yesss? And not one of thosssse C.E.L. assssholesss, right?"

"Perfect, welcome aboard Ssssylvan!" Sylvan activates the docking port, allowing you to enter the station.
You follow several signs that lead you to a large conference room filled with folding chairs, where several dozen Sylvans are sat making idle chatter. Several minutes after you enter, a Sylvan at the front of the room clangs a liquor bottle against the pulpit. "Hey! Everyone, lisssten to me! Guysss! I'm talking! SSSHUT THE HELL UP AND LISSSTEN TO ME GOD DAMN IT!" The room falls quiet as everyone turns to look at the Slug, who is now drinking from the bottle. "Hello everyone, Normal Ssssylvan here! Today I'll be presssenting the weekly S.I.L.V.A.N. addresssss. Like I alwaysss do, sssince I founded thisss organization." Normal Sylvan coughs and looks at a note card in his hand. "Unfortunately, Sssylvan from the reality where Sssylvan doesssn't exissst could not make it today. However, it ssseemsss we have sssome newcommersss!"
It takes you a moment to realize Normal Sylvan is referring to you. "You, weird people in the back. Why don't you introduce yourssselvess and the uh... reality you come from.
